required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Risk of Metabolic Adaptation After Weight Loss
clinical_study.official_title: Biomarkers of Increased Risk of Developing Metabolic Adaptation to Weight Loss

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims at identifying the neurohormonal biomarkers that characterize individuals at risk of greater metabolic adaptation to weight loss, a disproportionate decline in resting metabolic rate during and after weight loss.

primary_outcome.measure: change in measured and predicted resting metabolic rate during and after weight loss
primary_outcome.description: resting metabolic rate will be measured by indirect calorimetry every 2 months for 6 months, then every 6 months for an additional 12 month. Predicted resting metabolic rate will be calculated with a mathematical formula at the same time points

secondary_outcome.measure: change in circulating leptin during and after weight loss
secondary_outcome.description: blood will be assayed for this hormone every 2 months for 6 months, then every 6 months for an additional 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: change in circulating thyroid hormones during and after weight loss
secondary_outcome.description: blood will be assayed for this hormone every 2 months for 6 months, then every 6 months for an additional 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: change in circulating GLP-1 during and after weight loss
secondary_outcome.description: blood will be assayed for this hormone every 2 months for 6 months, then every 6 months for an additional 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: change in circulating PYY during and after weight loss
secondary_outcome.description: blood will be assayed for this hormone every 2 months for 6 months, then every 6 months for an additional 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: change in circulating AgRP during and after weight loss
secondary_outcome.description: blood will be assayed for this hormone every 2 months for 6 months, then every 6 months for an additional 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: change in 24h urine catecholamines during and after weight loss
secondary_outcome.description: urine will be assayed for these hormones every 2 months for 6 months, then every 6 months for an additional 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: change in heart rate variability during and after weight loss
secondary_outcome.description: blood will be assayed for this hormone every 2 months for 6 months, then every 6 months for an additional 12 months

arm_group.description: Participants will be enrolled in a weight loss program based on lifestyle changes and the use of phentermine-topiramate to aid with weight loss

intervention.description: participants will be enrolled in a medical weight loss program and will be prescribed phentermine-topiramate to help with weight loss. The goal of the study is NOT to assess efficacy or safety of this drug

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
BMI > or = 30 any ethnicity
Exclusion Criteria:
weight > or = 400 lbs.
diabetes (type 2 or type 1)
hypertension
heart disease
kidney disease
liver disease
active cancer
post solid organ or bone marrow transplant
HIV/AIDS
pregnancy
breastfeeding
current smoker
current recreational drug use
